name: Manuka
climate: Manuka thrives in a temperate climate, preferring mild conditions.
This plant is well-suited for coastal areas with sea breezes.
It can tolerate some degree of frost but not extreme cold.
High humidity levels are not favorable for Manuka growth.
sunlight: Manuka plants require full sunlight to grow optimally.
They can also tolerate partial shade, though flowering may be affected.
Sunlight helps in producing more essential oils in Manuka.
Protection from harsh afternoon sun may be necessary in hot climates.
watering: Manuka requires regular watering, especially during dry spells.
Good drainage is essential to prevent root rot from excess water.
The plant prefers a moderate moisture level, not overly wet.
Deep watering is recommended periodically to encourage root growth.
soil: Well-drained, slightly acidic to neutral soil is ideal for Manuka.
Manuka plants can grow in sandy, loamy, or gravelly soils.
Rich soil with organic matter can enhance plant health.
Avoid heavy clay soils, as they retain too much moisture.
extra_care_tip: Regular pruning helps maintain shape and encourages bushiness.
Prune after flowering to prevent woody growth and increase blooms.
Watch for pests like scale insects, which can harm the plant.
Manuka may benefit from mulch to retain soil moisture and reduce weeds.
